content: I have spend the last few weeks working through several Unity 3D and Blender tutorials getting a general
understanding of 3D game development. Many of the tutorials I have completed have been proved by
Quill18Â
on both his website and YouTube channel. Following these guides I have successfully implemented weapons in a First
Person Shooter game that act similar to both an automatic and semi-automatic rifle as well as a rocket launcher with
splash damage. My current goal is to create a multiplayer FPS game that is capable of combining several weapons
and allowing for actual multiplayer play.
Having completed the first 8 portions of the Multiplayer FPS guide provided by Quill18, I have successfully
created an environment in which up to 20 players can connect to each other using the Photon 3D Network
(free accounts are limited to 20 unique connections) and explore the environment. The repository is on my GitHub, check it out!

content: <ul>
• Blender - Open Source 3D graphics and animation software

• Photon Unity 3D Network - Framework for real-time multiplayer games and applications.
• Quill 18 Youtube Channel - Provider of many Unity 3D tutorials
• Unity 3D - Cross-platform development tool including game engine and IDE

content.title: Useful Tips for Blender
content: <ul>
• A = Select/Deselect All
• B = Select Edges/Faces/Vertices
• E = Extrude - Adjust single Edge/Face/Vertex
• G = Grab - Pull on Edge/Face/Vertex affecting surroundings
• Shift + A = Insert List
• Shift + Middle Click = Move around in Blender
• Space = Search for an action
• Tab = Switch between Object and Edit Mode
